pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [e85373a28c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21789/commits/e85373a28c4ded14c60cbfab68b09548a3ddc1c9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ a_zero`
`+ instance : Inhabited H.QuotientDiff`
`+ r_zero`
`- instance : Inhabited H.QuotientDiff := by`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (53.00, 0.01)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|3564|-53|porting notes|

Current commit [e85373a28c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/e85373a28c4ded14c60cbfab68b09548a3ddc1c9)
Reference commit [37ae3a8c90](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/37ae3a8c908cfb5321c6740ea43e62e142af4660)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13332125916/job/37238583208)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13332125916/job/37238583630)

Thanks!

bors merge

Thanks!

bors merge
Does norm_num still not work here? If not, isn't this still a valid porting note (perhaps can be linked to the tracking issue of things missing from norm_num)
Oops, restored.
The concern about having to specify `k` still applies here, right?
I wrote a new porting note about specifying `k` explicitly. Although I think it is a minor concern.
Is the dsimp still needed? This porting note reads like the `rw` used to work in Lean 3, but now needs the`dsimp` before it is successful: is this still true?
I don't know what happened here. This can all be one `rw`, but somehow didn't end up in the patch :shrug:

```suggestion
    (Perm.subtypeEquivSubtypePerm p f).1 a = f a, h :=
```
maybe?
Is `IsRotated.refl` still needed here? If not, it looks like the porting note still applies.
Restored.
As far as I can tell, this issue is still open: is there a reason to stop tracking it?
I am proposing to declare almost all of these wontfix.

I agree with Johan here: needing to copy instances for non-reducible `def`s is how Lean 4 is designed. Perhaps `deriving` should be improved so we don't have to do this manually, but the fact of copying is a wontfix.
Makes sense. I agree deriving would be nice here too!
Do we still need the `:` here? If so, it seems to me like the porting note still applies.
You are right.
Does `decide` work here? If not, can we isolate what the regression in `decide` is?

To me this doesn't look like a goal that `decide` should be solving, especially after the revert.
My guess is that `decide` was applying `no_confusion` under the hood. I'm not sure that is its job.
So I propose wontfix.
Does dot notation still not work here?
Restored.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(GroupTheory): process a first batch of porting notes
